title: Lula replaces head of public bank, caters to center-right parties
description:
President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva on Wednesday fired Rita Serrano from her position as head of Caixa, a federal bank that handles the payments of Brazil’s social security benefits and is the country’s largest by customers. Ms. Serrano will be replaced by Carlos Antônio Vieira Fernandes, a longtime employee of the bank and former […]

The post Lula replaces head of public bank, caters to center-right parties appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Economic optimism ticks down, taking Lula’s approval rates with it

title: Big Agro wants to override Lula on indigenous land rights issue
description:
Lawmakers allied to Big Agro have pledged to override President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva’s veto of a bill aiming to curtail the rights of indigenous peoples to their lands. In recent years, Big Agro has defended the so-called “time-frame argument.” It seeks to define October 5, 1988 — the date the Brazilian Constitution was […]

The post Big Agro wants to override Lula on indigenous land rights issue appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Explaining Brazil #267: The Milei risk for Brazil
description:
If Javier Milei were to win the presidential race in Argentina, his government is bound to be anything but business as usual for Brazil
